dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Coal tar is a sticky, black substance, made from coal, used to make various chemical products. It is obtained by distillation of bituminous coal and used especially as an industrial fuel, in making dyes, and in the topical treatment of skin disorders. It is the principal liquid product resulting from the carbonization of coal, i.e., the heating of coal in the absence of air, at temperatures ranging from about 900 to 1,200 °C. Many commercially important compounds are derived from coal tar. Low-temperature tars result when coal, peat, lignite, or wood are carbonized at temperatures not exceeding 700 °C. Upon further distillation, it yields compounds, as benzene, anthracene, and phenol, from which are derived a large number of dyes, drugs, and other synthetic compounds, and that yields a final residuum (coal-tar pitch), which is used chiefly in making pavements.

煤焦油是一种由煤制成的粘性黑色物质，用于制造各种化学产品。它通过蒸馏烟煤获得，主要用作工业燃料、染料和皮肤病的局部治疗。它是煤炭碳化过程中产生的主要液体产品，即在没有空气的情况下，在大约 900 到 1200 °C 的温度下加热煤炭。许多具有重要商业价值的化合物都来自煤焦油。低温焦油是煤炭、泥煤、褐煤或木材在不超过 700 °C 的温度下碳化产生的。进一步蒸馏后，会产生苯、蒽和苯酚等化合物，从这些化合物中衍生出大量染料、药物和其他合成化合物，最后产生的残渣（煤焦油沥青）主要用于铺设路面。
